Kayako - ticket id 60177804 // Arafat Bakhsh commented publicly: Dear Bennett,

Thank you for sending the logs and support info. We’ve reviewed them and identified several factors contributing to the intermittent “freeze” where mail stops until you restart the server.

What we found

	* POP3 download authentication failures: Multiple remote accounts are repeatedly failing to authenticate against mail.caio.com.br:995 [http://mail.caio.com.br:995/], which triggers continuous retries and load.
	* File locking by antivirus/backup: Temporary antivirus files in the Kerio store cannot be removed because they’re held by another process, which is typical of real-time AV or backup scanning the mailstore.
	* Full-Text Search service timeouts: The fulltext process is timing out shortly after start, which can stall components and add CPU load.
	* Corrupted queue envelopes: Some .env files in the message queue are invalid and block normal processing.
	* Ongoing mailbox index repairs: Many folders are being auto-recovered from index logs, adding extra I/O during operation.

Action plan to stabilize

	* POP3 download cleanup

	* In Administration Console, go to Configuration > Delivery > POP3 Download and:

	* Correct invalid credentials or disable failing accounts temporarily (we see several failures against mail.caio.com.br [http://mail.caio.com.br/]).
	* If any accounts are set to “leave messages on server” but the provider doesn’t support UIDL, uncheck that option for those accounts.
	* Use “Download Now” on a corrected account to confirm successful retrieval.

	* Exclude Kerio from antivirus/backup scanning

	* Configure your AV/backup to exclude the Kerio installation and the entire store, including tmp and queue. Based on your paths, exclude:

	* C:\Program Files\Kerio\MailServer\
	* E:\Kerio\MailServer\store\
	* E:\Kerio\MailServer\store\tmp\
	* E:\Kerio\MailServer\store\queue\
	* E:\Kerio\MailServer\store\archive\
	* E:\Kerio\MailServer\store\backup\

	* If possible, temporarily pause real-time scanning to validate improvement, then re-enable with the exclusions in place.

	* Full‑Text Search (FTS) triage

	* Short term: disable FTS in Configuration > Advanced Options > Store Directory > Full‑Text Search to remove the timeout from the equation.
	* After the system is stable, please re-enable FTS and rebuild the fulltext index in a maintenance window.

	* Clear corrupted queue envelopes

	* Stop the Kerio Connect service.

	* Back up the queue folder:

	* E:\Kerio\MailServer\store\queue

	* Remove only the specific corrupted .env files referenced in the logs (do not delete .eml files).
	* Start the Kerio Connect service and confirm that the queue processes normally.

	* Finish mailbox index repairs

	* In Admin Console, go to Accounts > Users, select impacted users, and run More Actions > Reindex Mailbox. This lets Kerio complete the index work cleanly and reduces repeated I/O.

Please let us know if the issue persists.

References

	* Antivirus Exclusions for Kerio Connect [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/115965]
	* Full Text Search Is Crashing with Timeout Errors [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/114805]
	* Troubleshooting Full Text Search Functionality Issues in Kerio Connect [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/114129]
	* Fixing Data Consistency Issues [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/114336]
	* Configuring POP3 for Remote Emails and Applying Sorting Rules in Kerio Connect [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/115891]
	* Error: “Empty envelope file” in the Log File on MacOS/Linux [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/112611]
	* Starting or Stopping the Kerio Connect Server on Windows [https://support.kerioconnect.gfi.com/article/114508]

Best regards,
Arafat Bakhsh
